rename.from: doc: update PyZMQ installation instructions, ZeroMQ link
rename.to: script, doc: update PyZMQ install instructions, fix zmq_sub.py file permissions

events.body: If I'm not mistaken, `contrib/zmq/zmq_sub.py` has the wrong file permissions; changed them to `755`.

ACK 062e6699c4ac48c3d46516190ec411dec3680a0d ðŸ§· 
Checked that the changed/introduced URLs are visitable and correct and that the PyZMQ install instruction via pip works (tested in Ubuntu Xenial). Also ran the zmq_sub.py script directly to double-check that the execution flag is set now.

rename.from: script, doc: update PyZMQ install instructions, fix zmq_sub.py file permissions
rename.to: doc: update PyZMQ install instructions, fix zmq_sub.py file permissions

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -1,6 +1,6 @@
 # Block and Transaction Broadcasting with ZeroMQ
 
-[ZeroMQ](http://zeromq.org/) is a lightweight wrapper around TCP
+[ZeroMQ](https://zeromq.org/) is a lightweight wrapper around TCP
comments.body: How are we stil finding http links in the repository in the year 2020 :sweat_smile:

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -1,6 +1,6 @@
 # Block and Transaction Broadcasting with ZeroMQ
 
-[ZeroMQ](http://zeromq.org/) is a lightweight wrapper around TCP
+[ZeroMQ](https://zeromq.org/) is a lightweight wrapper around TCP
comments.body:
Thanks for fixing @jonatack! :)

---

Aside:

A `scripted-diff` might be needed to bring the remaining old school style links to year 2020 :)

```
$ git grep 'http://www.opensource.org/licenses/mit-license.php' | wc -l
1092
```

Bonus points if we can remove the external -- and thus potentially changing -- reference to simply referencing the `COPYING` file. That would get rid of the horrible `php` extension too :)

_Edit: Not a suggestion for this PR._

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -1,6 +1,6 @@
 # Block and Transaction Broadcasting with ZeroMQ
 
-[ZeroMQ](http://zeromq.org/) is a lightweight wrapper around TCP
+[ZeroMQ](https://zeromq.org/) is a lightweight wrapper around TCP
comments.body: True :dango: :icecream:  though updating all those links isn't really in the scope of this patch. I actually only noticed the http url just before opening it. :shipit:

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -1,6 +1,6 @@
 # Block and Transaction Broadcasting with ZeroMQ
 
-[ZeroMQ](http://zeromq.org/) is a lightweight wrapper around TCP
+[ZeroMQ](https://zeromq.org/) is a lightweight wrapper around TCP
comments.body:
Ahhhhh updating 1002 files sounds â€¦ pretty awful â€¦ that fully answers my question though. Together with XML schemas and such it makes it hard to search for relevant ones. 
Agree it's out of scope of this PR, if worthwhile at all (not sure anymroe).
